description: Registered Education Savings Plan (RESP) synthetic data template. An RESP is a tax-deferred account in Canada designed to help save for a child’s post-secondary education. This template includes fields for plan details, account holder and beneficiary information, contribution limits, government grants, and eligible education expenses.

RESP_ID.description: Unique identifier for the RESP account.

PlanType.description: Type of RESP account: Individual or Family.

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the RESP account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the RESP account holder.

BeneficiaryDOB.description: Date of birth of the beneficiary.

RelationshipToHolder.description: Relationship of the beneficiary to the RESP account holder.

Beneficiaries.description: List of beneficiaries associated with the RESP.

TotalContribution.description: Total contributions made to the RESP, with a lifetime limit of $50,000 per beneficiary.

CESGReceived.description: Total Canada Education Savings Grant (CESG) received, with a lifetime maximum of $7,200 per beneficiary.

BCTESG.description: B.C. Training and Education Savings Grant (BCTESG), up to $1,200.

QESI.description: Québec Education Savings Incentive (QESI), with a lifetime maximum of $3,600.

ProvincialGrants.description: Provincial grants received under the RESP.

InvestmentTypes.description: List of investment types held within the RESP.

AccountCreationDate.description: Date when the RESP account was established.

EligibleExpenses.description: List of eligible education expenses covered by RESP withdrawals.

TotalBalance.description: Current total balance of the RESP account.

WithdrawnAmount.description: Total amount withdrawn from the RESP for educational expenses.

WithdrawnBy.description: Who withdrew the funds: the beneficiary or the account holder.
